property.name: Rules
property.value: Play only if Runner is tagged. Runner's MU is reduced by 2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They always think it's a hoax."

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ Do 2 Net damage. @ Trace5â€“ If trace is successful, give Runner a Baskerville counter. Each counter does 2 Net damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Baskerville counter by taking an action to spend [3]. @ End the run. If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Baskerville is reduced by [5].

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:Inflict2NetDamage-onOpponent||A0B0G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{end the run}||A0B0G0T0:Trace5||A0B0G0T0:Infect1Baskerville-onOpponent

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ Do 4 Net damage. @ Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice encountered during this run. If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Bolter Swarm is reduced by [5].

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:Inflict4NetDamage-onOpponent||Simply Announce{stop the runner from breaking any subroutines on the next piece of ice encountered during this run}

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Sentry-Black Ice-AP

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ Roll a die. On a 1, do 3 brain damage.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Weefs never look 'up.'" -Edger

property.name: Rules
property.value: Draw five cards, then shuffle a card stored in HQ into R&D. (Playing a double operation costs two consecutive actions this turn instead of one.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's a shell game for the shareholders."

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Gray Ops

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put a Remap counter on Data Fort Remapping when you score it. Remap Counter: End a run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "In netspace, the map is often the territory. That's just one more reason we don't hire philosopy grads." -Dave Michaels

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:Remove1Remap-isCost$$SimplyAnnounce{end the run}

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ Trash a program. @ End the run. If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Deadeye is reduced by [5].

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Wakes up shooting at the drop of a hat

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{end the run}||A0B0G0T0:TrashTarget-Targeted-atProgram

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Deflector

property.name: Rules
property.value: Dumpster cannot be installed on the Archives. @ Runner is now encountering the outermost piece of rezzed ice on the Archives, instead of passing Dumpster. The run is now considered to be a run on the Archives. If there is no rezzed ice on the Archives, Runner is considered to have passed the last piece of ice on the Archives.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{deflect the run to the Archives}

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Deflector

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ If you pay [2], Runner is now encountering the outermost piece of rezzed ice on a data fort of your choice, instead of passing Entrapment. The run is now considered to be a run on that data fort. If there is no rezzed ice on that fort, Runner is considered to have passed the last piece of ice on that fort.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B2G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{deflect the run to target Data Fort}

property.name: Rules
property.value: Rezzing Glacier cost 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. @ End the run. @ End the run. [1]: Move Glacier to the outermost position of any other data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run. You may use this ability even if Glacier is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.

property.name: AutoScript
property.value: onRez:Lose1Agenda Points-isCost

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{end the run}||A0B1G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{move Glacier to the outermost position of target data fort}-onAccess

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ Trash a program. @ End the run. If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Imperial Guard is reduced by [5].

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Black Ops

property.name: Rules
property.value: After Runner makes a successful run, you may have Runner shuffle his or her hand into his or her stack and then draw as many cards as he or she had before.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "But did you get him?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Runner must pay [1], in addition to the normal cost, to use each subroutine of a noisy icebreaker during runs on this fort.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: London: home to Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, and some of the nastiest, most insidious, and downright brilliant code this side of the Pond.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ End the run, and trash Puzzle at end of turn. @ End the run, and trash Puzzle at end of turn.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{end the run}$$Put1Solved

property.name: Rules
property.value: Search the archives for any number of ice cards. Show those cards to Runner, then store them in HQ. (Playing a double operation costs two consecutive actions this turn instead of one.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The code's already there; why let it go to waste?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the start of each of your turns, you may roll a die for each run Runner made during his or her last turn. For each 1, give Runner a tag.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Say, isn't that your daughter?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Install Self-Destruct only in a subsidiary data fort. [T] Trash all other cards installed in or on this data fort. Do 1 Net damage for each card successfully trashed in this way. Use this ability only when Runner accesses Self-Destruct.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "This'll ream our bottom line unless we reclassify data-entry clerks as 'consumables.'"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Runner accesses Shock Treatment, trash all pieces of hardware and two programs. Ignore this effect unless Runner has four or more tags.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Yo, Bob, red light. Bob? Red Light! Bob, c'mon - I'm serious! GAH! Now there's a fire and a red light! Bob?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: [3], [T]: Choose a piece of ice. That ice's strength is doubled until end of turn. If this would raise the ice's strength above 10, ist strength becomes 10.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Runners love this one like bikers adore wires across roads." -Norman Niemann, WuTech security director

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you draw one or more cards, draw an extra card. Then place one of the drawn cards on the bottom of R&D.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We don't plot; we faciliate."

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the start of each run on this data fort, Runner loses [X], where X is equal to the number of tags Runner has.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I think you know why I'm here."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Superserum, remove all Virus counters, and avoid receiving the next two Virus counters Runner gives to you.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "A holisitc approach to system immunology: its AI routines mark both computer viruses and suspect moles for deletion."

property.name: Rules
property.value: If Runner accesses Theorem Proof, he or she does not score it, but instead may install it as a 2 MU program that has the ability "[A]: Score Theorem Proof" but is removed from the game if it leaves play in any other way.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Deflector

property.name: Rules
property.value: Install Trapdoor only on R&D or HQ. @ Runner is now encountering the outermost piece of rezzed ice on a subsidiary data fort of your choice, instead of passing Trapdoor. The run is now considered to be a run on that data fort. If there is no rezzed ice on that fort, Runner is considered to have passed the last piece of ice on that fort. Runner automatically breaks this subroutine if there are no subsidiary data forts.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B0G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{deflect the run to the target Subsidiary Data Fort}

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Asset-Gray Ops

property.name: Rules
property.value: Draw an additional card at the start of each of your turns.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You may feel some discomfort."

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Deflector

property.name: Rules
property.value: @ If you pay [2], Runner is now encountering the outermost piece of rezzed ice on a data fort of your choice, instead of passing Vortex. The run is now considered to be a run on that data fort. If there is no rezzed ice on that fort, Runner is considered to have passed the last piece of ice on that fort.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B2G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{deflect the run to the target Data Fort}

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trash your hand. Search your stack for as many cards as were successfuly trashed in this way and bring them into your hand. Shuffle your stack afterward.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If you don't fear death, they're great to hang with."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Play only if you scored any agendas this turn. Lose all agenda points you scored this turn, and the Corp scores that many agenda points. Gain [10] per agenda point lost in this way, and the Corp gives you a tag.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Excuse me, Dave? Can I borrow 250,000 eb 'til payday?"

property.name: AutoScript
property.value: onPlay:RequestInt-Msg{How many Agenda Points did you score this turn?}$$Lose1Agenda Points-perX-isCost$$Gain10Bits-perX$$Gain1Tags

property.name: Rules
property.value: Gain [1] at the start of each of your turns. All trace attempts are automatically successful, and give you a tag in addition to their other effects. If Crash Space leaves play lose [2]. [A] Trash Crash Space.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Suffer any amount of brain damage, but not enough to flatline you or to reduce your hand size to less than 0. Gain [4] for each point of brain damage you suffer in this way. This damage cannot be prevented.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I may be stupid, but I'm rich!"

property.name: Rules
property.value: [1]: Break wall subroutine. [2]: +3 strength

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Early Worm gets the bird ... from corporate sysops." -AI Boone

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B1G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{break wall subroutine}||A0B2G0T0:Put3PlusOne

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you play a prep, gain an additional [1] the first time you gain bits from its effet.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "... But somehow you never go away thinking you got the best of the deal."

property.name: Rules
property.value: [2],[T]: Look at all cards stored in HQ.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I only signed a noncompete agreement; it didn't say anything about nondisclosure."

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B2G0T1:SimplyAnnounce{look at all cards stored in HQ}

property.name: Rules
property.value: Roll three dice. Gain that many bits.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Looks like both our luck's changed."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, do not access any cards. Instead, reveal cards one at a time from R&D until you reveal an agenda card or there are no cards left in R&D. Store the agenda, if any, in HQ and shuffle the other revealed cards, if any, into R&D.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Make a run on R&D or HQ. If run is successful, access two additional cards if you used no noisy icebreakers during the run and if no trace attempts were made during the run.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Provides +1 MU and +1 hand size. Prevent up to 1 Net or brain damage each turn. Put [1] from the bank on Little Black Box when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for increasing your link. If you use the bit, replace it from the bank at the start of your next turn.

property.name: AutoScript
property.value: whileRezzed:Gain1MU$$Gain1Hand Size||onInstall:Put1Bits$$Put1protectionNetBrainDMG||atTurnStart:Refill1Bits$$Refill1protectionNetBrainDMG||whileRezzed:Reduce#CostUse-forBase Link

property.name: Rules
property.value: [1]: Break sentry subroutine. [3]: +5 strength

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This little fella really cuts through the bull.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B1G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{gain sentry subroutine}||A0B3G0T0:Put5PlusOne

property.name: Rules
property.value: Remove up to two tags, at no cost, and draw three cards. (Playing a double prep costs two consecutive actions this turn instead of one.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: They can make you gorgeous cheap, but to make you plain costs extra.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [1]: Break sentry subroutine. [1]: +1 strength. The first time during each run that you break a sentry subroutine with MS-todon, lose all bits from all stealth cards, if you can, and the Corp gives you a tag.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This isn't running - it's stomping.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B1G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{break sentry subroutine}||A0B1G0T0:Put1PlusOne

property.name: Rules
property.value: Gain [9]. (Playing a double prep costs two consecutive actions this turn instead of one.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's not what you know or even who; it's how often."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Provides +1 Mu. Put [2] from the bank on Omnitech "Spinal Tap" Cybermodem when it is installed. Use this bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs or increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. At the start of each of your turns roll a die. On a 1, suffer 2 brain damage. This damage cannot be prevented. If Omnitech "Spinal Tap" Cyermodem leaves play suffer 2 brain damage.

property.name: AutoScript
property.value: whileRezzed:Gain2MU||onInstall:Put2Bits||whileRezzed:Reduce#CostUse-forBase Link||whileRezzed:Reduce#CostUse-forIcebreaker||onTrash:Inflict2BrainDamage||atTurnStart:Roll1Dice-chk1$$Inflict2BrainDamage-nonPreventable-perX

property.name: Rules
property.value: Your base MU is equal to the number of cards in your hand instead of 4.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Now with reduced long-term memory loss!" - Rejected marketing slogan

property.name: Rules
property.value: Gain [4] and draw two cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "So I just drive a truck from Point A to Point B? How hard can that be?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: [1]: Break code gate subroutine. [2]: +1 strength until end of turn

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Call now for ten nanoseconds of icebreaking absolutely free! (10 eb each subsequent ns.)"

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B1G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{break code gate subroutine}||A0B2G0T0:Put1PlusOne

property.name: Rules
property.value: [1]: Break ice subroutine. At the end of this run, trash Rent-I-Con. [1]: +1 strength.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It's big and mean and lasts about sixteen microseconds.

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B1G0T0:SimplyAnnounce{break subroutine}$$Put1Spent||A0B1G0T0:Put1PlusOne

property.name: Rules
property.value: Make a run. During that run, the Corp must pay [X], in addition to the normal cost, to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that piece of ice.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Look! A distraction!"

property.name: Rules
property.value: [3], [T]: Look at the top three cards stored in R&D.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "As long as the drones keep griping online, I'm in business."

property.name: AutoAction
property.value: A0B3G0T1:SimplyAnnounce{look at the top three cards stored in R&D

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you access cards from HQ, expose all of the Corp's installed cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Not only is the map the terrain - somtimes you can only get places by folding the map." -Edger

property.name: Rules
property.value: [T]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only if you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Epoxy both your houses!" -Bard

property.name: Rules
property.value: [1], Forgo your next action: Avoid receiving a tag.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I'm not firing a LAW at that! It's a classic!"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put [1] from the bank on Zetatech Portostation when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for playing preps. If you use the bit, replace it from the bank at the start of your next turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Zetatech. All you need is a brain, a deck, and a afriend." - Short-lived WNS ad campaign
